page.title: 01SUMMARY OF AREA.
page.content: Our area lies between Widnes, St. Helens and Warrington. Widnes is the closest, it's boundary actually runs through our area. Despite this, of our 12 square kilometers, only two are built upon. The remainder are farmed. Lying where it does, it is inevitable that roads here will carry much traffic and this is the case on the two parallel major roads that run east/west roughly 1/3 and 2/3 down our block. There is evidence of recession and economies in that one of the two railways is derelict and there are areas of industrial dereliction both around existing factories and on abandoned sites, although these are small. In summary, the block is mainly low-lying rural land which contains two distinct urban areas whose spread is limited by county boundaries.
